text: The Lède is a river of south-western France that flows through the Lot-et- Garonne department, in the region of Nouvelle-Aquitaine. It is a right tributary of the Lot river. ==Geography== The Lède has a length of about , and a drainage basin with an area of approximately . Its average yearly discharge is at Casseneuil where the Lède joins the Lot. The largest discharges are during winter, with in February. It flows generally to the southwestwest and passes through the communes, all in the Lot-et-Garonne department, of Blanquefort-sur-Briolance, Lacapelle-Biron, Paulhiac, Laussou, Gavaudun, La Sauvetat-sur-Lède, Monflanquin, Montagnac-sur-Lède, Salles, Lédat (it takes its name from the river), Villeneuve-sur-Lot and Casseneuil, where it flows into the Lot. It joins the Lot on its right bank, at about of altitude. ==Tributaries== Most of tributaries of the Lède river are very short; only two tributaries are over 10 km long: * Laussou - 13.2 km * Leyze - 12.9 km ==Related pages== * List of rivers of France == References == ==Other websites== * Banque Hydro - Station O8584010 - La Lède à Casseneuil Category:Rivers of Nouvelle-Aquitaine
title: Lède
